The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Create the first face of the sketch with the following components: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.2763, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point = [0.2763, 0.0], End Point = [0.2763, 0.1184] - Line 3: Start Point = [0.2763, 0.1184], End Point = [0.0, 0.1184] - Line 4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.1184], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.75 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.2763 - Operation: New Body Feature Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times its diameter. The top and bottom of the cylinder are flat. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1103, 0.0609, 0.1184] Create the first face of the sketch with the following components: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center = [0.0279, 0.0279], Radius = 0.0279 Extrude the sketch with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.1184 - Sketch scale: 0.0557 - Operation: Cut Feature The dimensions of the parts are as follows: - Part 1: - Length: 0.2763 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.2763 - Part 2: - Length: 0.0557 - Width: 0.0557 - Height: 0.1184 - Final Shape: - Length: 2 - Width: 1 - Height: 0.5 (with a slightly tapered middle section)</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.005, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines as follows: 1. line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.6, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point = [0.6, 0.0], End Point = [0.6, 0.75] 3. line\\_3: Start Point = [0.6, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.75] 4. line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter `sketch_scale` with a value of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by rotating it with the given Euler angles and translating it with the translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D using the `extrude_depth_towards_normal` value of 0.005 and `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` value of 0.0, creating a new solid body. **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with flat top and bottom** Start with creating a new coordinate system, using the same coordinate system as Part 1 by setting Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.005, 0.0]. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system and draw a rectangle identical to Part 1 using the provided line endpoints. As before, scale the 2D sketch using `sketch_scale` with a value of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D by setting `extrude_depth_towards_normal` to 0.0 and `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` to 0.0. Since this part is joining the previous part, make sure to use the 'JoinFeatureOperation' for the 'operation' field, adding material to the existing body. This will create a final shape of a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, with front face angled at approximately 45 degrees from the top and bottom faces. The height, width, and length of the final shape and the intermediate parts are: - Height: 0.75 - Width: 0.005 and 5.0e-05 (for Part 1 and Part 2, respectively) - Length: 0.75</description>
